description:
China’s tax law and international tax policy play an important role in influencing cross-border transactions. Chinese tax system and treaty network could affect both business structure and profits derived from the transaction, while Chinese tax administration measures and the way to resolve tax disputes are factors for assessing business risk. This course will cover these Chinese tax issues
through providing lectures, practical exploration and peer-learning in a seminar environment.
title: China's Tax Law and International Tax Policy
prerequisite: NUS Compulsory Core Law Curriculum or equivalent.
